pullRequest.title: Mark tasks as DROPPED if assigned participant does not exist
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues

 My PR addresses the following Helix issues and references them in the PR description:
Fixes #1567

Description

 Here are some details about my PR, including screenshots of any UI changes:
In this PR, if the workflow or job is being stopped, but the assigned participant becomes offline for the task, the
task would be marked as DROPPED which allows the workflow and job to go to STOPPED state.

commit.message:
Mark task to DROPPED for the workflows being stopped

In this commit, if the workflow or job is being stopped, but
the assigned participant becomes offline for the task, the
ttask would be marked as DROPPED which allow the workflow
and job to go to STOPPED state.

nodes.bodyText: This looks like an override of processing result... Can we have the logic in somewhere in scheduling task? This is more like a patching after scheduling computation. It waste the scheduling computation if instance is not live.
You might want to move it to TaskPartitionState class.
It seems no one except JobDispatcher needs this method. Can we just move it to there?
